title: 2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl
text:
Welcome to the 2023 Hessian Election Dashboard
    This dashboard aggregates data from the Meta Ad Library to show how citizens are targeted during the 2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl.
    If you want to know more about Who Targets Me and our work on ad transparency, visit us on whotargets.me!
  





2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl
This section shows total and daily spending of political parties in the run-up to the 2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl for the latest available data.

title: Targeting
text: This section shows spending per targeting criteria used by political parties to reach citizens in the run-up to the 2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl for the latest available data. It only includes targeting on Meta platforms (Facebook and Instagram), which offers the most detailed targeting options to political advertisers.

title: Targeting
text:
Spending per Targeting Criteria
How much did campaigns spend on different targeting methods? The graphs below show spending overall across all parties and by party.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)



OverallBy Party







































































OverallBy Party

title: Targeting
text:
Top Targeted (Detailed) Audiences
Here, we show the top targeted audiences for each party for the â€œdetailedâ€ targeting that Meta offers (ranked by amount of Euro spend). Most (but not all) of these audiences are â€œinterestâ€ audiences, i.e.Â the parties targeted people interested in â€œBooksâ€ or â€œPoliticsâ€.

Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Top Contested Audiences
Here, we show the top most contested audiences, i.e.Â where all parties have spent considerable amounts of money competing to reach voters with the same interests.

Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Geographical Targeting
The graphs below show various kinds of location targeting that parties engaged in on Meta platforms. The bigger the area the more money was spend by the party on targeting this location.

Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)



RegionsCities

title: Targeting
text:
Geographical Exclusion
On Meta, political parties can also exclude certain geographical units. The graphs below show which locations were excluded from seeing political advertisements and how much money the parties spend on these ads. The bigger the area the more money was spend on ads excluding this location.

Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)



RegionsCities

title: Targeting
text:
Age Targeting
The graphs below show targeting by age groups and how much percentage of party budgets were spent on them.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Gender Targeting
The graphs below show targeting by gender and how much percentage of party budgets were spent on them.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.

title: Targeting
text:
Education Targeting
The graphs below show targeting by education levels and how much percentage of party budgets were spent on them.

Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: Targeting
text:
Job Targeting
The graphs below show targeting by job (sectors) and how much percentage of party budgets were spent on them.

Note: targeting criteria can overlap so the percentages do not sum up to 100%.


Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 30 days)Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023 (Last 7 days)

title: 2023 Election Dashboard Hessen {{< iconify openmoji flag-poland rotate=180deg >}}
text:
Methodology
In collaboration with Who Targets Me, we monitored 584 political advertisers in Hessen during the 2023 Hessen Landtwagswahl to better understand how campaigns use different targeting methods made available by Meta. To do this, we used data from the Meta Ad Library, using the new â€˜Audienceâ€™ data which gives some detail on how pages target their ads.
To better understand the election, we kept only advertisers who:

Advertised in the last 7 days (Sep 27th - Oct 3rd 2023)
Advertised in the last 30 days (Sep 4th - Oct 3rd 2023)







Note



Meta only provides 7, 30 and 90 days windows for the targeting data in their Ad Library. Metaâ€™s data also lags by a few days. Report will be updated as soon as new data is available.


For Google platforms, data accessed via the Google Transparency Report provides spending on how much money was spent by parties. In order to fit the Meta ranges, we also show the last seven and 30 days.






Disclaimer



The data shown in this dashboard is based on the platformâ€™s respective ad libraries which are known to be sometimes incomplete (Edelson et al.Â 2020; Silva et al.Â 2020). For this reason the data shown here might not reflect the full picture nor all political ads that were targeted at voters.




About the Creator of the Dashboard











Fabio Votta is a Postdoc at the University of Amsterdam who studies (online) political microtargeting and its usage around the world.











Want to see how political parties target you? Sign up at Who Targets Me and download the gratis browser plugin to see how parties on Facebook use your data:
https://whotargets.me/







Want to retrieve targeting data from the Facebook Ad Library yourself? This dashboard is powered by the R package: metatargetr. Check it out here:
https://github.com/favstats/metatargetr




Election Targeting Dashboards
A list of election dashboards:

text:

Here, we show the top excluded audiences for each party for the â€œdetailedâ€ targeting that Meta offers (ranked by amount of Euro spend). Most (but not all) of these audiences are â€œinterestâ€ audiences, i.e.Â the parties excluded people interested in â€œBooksâ€ or â€œPoliticsâ€.
